instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
It chimes with backlight. no image. i also have tried external display and nothing, even with LCD cable unplug.


<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> = 0.9v
L8360 = 0v (should be 1.36v) - resistance to GND on L8360 is 172 ohms
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 12.58v

I've already replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, I've reflowed the old and its still same,

yes. there seems to be USB activity. I've tried other bios from a donor board for testing and its the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
You are missing vRAM voltage; can't get GPU working.
Check <CHIP>U8350</CHIP> voltages; pins 15, 19, 20.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R8359</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8355</CAPACITOR> are OK.
Also check all traces and resistors aroun <CHIP>U8350</CHIP>.

You may need to change <CHIP>U8350</CHIP> and/or <TRANSISTOR>Q8360</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
OMG, you are right.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is missing on the <CHIP>U8350</CHIP>

i couldnt see it because fan cable was in the way.

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/wx77XE4.jpg[/IMG]
